title: Grazing and Haying Cover Crops with Josh Roe

subtasks: Research cover crop mixes and planting dates.
Source and purchase cover crop seeds.
Prepare field for planting (chemical treatments, tilling, etc.).
Drill cover crop seeds into prepared field.
Monitor cover crop growth and provide supplemental irrigation if needed.
Harvest cover crops for grazing or hay.
Graze livestock on cover crops and document gain rates.
Bale and store remaining cover crops for future use.
Evaluate soil health and crop yields in subsequent years.
Assess economic benefits and costs of cover crop rotation.
Account for labor and equipment costs involved in planting, managing, and harvesting cover crops.
Monitor and address potential issues such as weed competition, fertilizer carryover, or soil erosion.
